result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Lee Shumate

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD / 10:37 AM Defendant Jeremy Lee Shumate appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack not in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reset.
Arraignment scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD:  1:30 pm  Attny Novack appeared by video.  Court indicated case was set for 10 AM, and gave Attny Novack new date and time.

9:54 AM Defendant Jeremy Lee Shumate appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Jeremy Lee Shumate.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews the court record.  Court makes a record regarding the initial appearance on August 23, 2022 and the status of the waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court orders on its own motion constructive waiver of time limits on August 23, 2022 based on review of unofficial transcript.  Attny Novack no comment, but indicates Courts record is correct regarding the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Atty Novack waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:50 AM Defendant Jeremy Lee Shumate not in court, DEF in custody in Barron County Jail.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Jeremy Lee Shumate.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court goes on the record and makes statement.    Attny Novack makes statement.  Discussion takes places regarding waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing,  Attny Novack states DEF waived time limits.  Court reset preliminary hearing.  DEF did not appear due to issues in Barron County Jail.  Court indicates if there are zoom issues, DEF is to be transported here for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

COMBINED BOND  22CF172, 22CF173, and 22CF152  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
